result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather M. Maruna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence is imposed and stayed, if imposed , defendant is granted huber privileges and 60 days to pay any outstanding financial obligations as ordered by the Court.  If revoked, defendant is granted credit for 89 days served.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
Consecutive to: Probation in this case is to run consecutive to any existing sentence and in particular, the prison sentence in Polk County case 15CF369.

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather M. Maruna

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Heather M. Maruna, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.

ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State,  Attorney Christine Kuczynski appeared while the defendant, Heather M. Maruna, is in custody appearing by video conference from the Clark County Jail.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Heather M. Maruna, appeared via video from Clark County Jail with Attorney Christine Kuczynski present  in the courtroom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 02:50 pm.

Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Heather M. Maruna, appeared by video from Clark County Jail with Attorney Christine Kuczynski appearing in person in court  Status conference scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Clark County Jail with Attorney Kuczynski appearing in person in court requesting an additional status.  Status conference scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Pre-trial conference at 12-01-2015 02:00 pm.
Status conference at 12-03-2015 08:30 am.

ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Christine Kuczynski  Defendant acknowledges receipt of the Information  Waived reading of Information  THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY

Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Heather M. Maruna, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski. Preliminary hearing waived  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Polk County Jail with Attorney Kuczynski appearing in person in court(video client/attorney conference held)  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint  Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing. Defense requests bond modification to $500.00 cash. State objects to any change.  Court finds bail appropriate, denies request.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 03:10 pm.

ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Polk County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Defendant will seek an attorney  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 09:40 am.
